titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mario Cardullo Papers, 1953-2013 MS2387
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection contains documents, records, photographs and other materials related to Mario Cardullo. The material dates from 1955 to 2013. Dr. Cardullo was a writer and inventor, most known for creating modern radio-frequency identification (RFID) technology. In addition, he held numerous other patents.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Series 2, Subseries 10 contains confidential correspondence regarding patent information. Special Collections will review materials in this subseries before researchers can access this subseries. Please contact Special Collections for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that he owns copyright, the donor has retained copyright in his works donated to The George Washington University. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For activities that the researcher determines fall under fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights, determining if the intended re-use falls under fair use, and obtaining approval from the copyright holder if the intended use does not fall under fair use. Researchers do not need anything further from The George Washington University Special Collections Research Center. Please contact Special Collections if the copyright status of the materials you wish to reuse is unclear. Staff will provide additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mario Cardullo, 2019 (2019.037). An addition was donated by Mario Cardullo in 2021 (2021.021).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Mario William Cardullo (b. May 16, 1935) is a prolific inventor and writer, most known for creating the modern RFID. He received his BMA and MME at the Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute (now the New York University Tandon School of Engineering), his MEA at the George Washington University School of Engineering and Applied Science, and his PhD in Information Technology from George Mason University. He worked as a System Engineer for Bellcomm, Inc., contributing to the Apollo Program. Cardullo later worked for Communications Satellite Corp, where he worked on maritime communications satellites in 1966. He developed the RDIF-TAG in 1969. He holds numerous patents for his inventions, and has served as a college professor and adjunct. Cardullo has published over 200 works, including 2 textbooks, and several papers and articles. Among other accolades, Cardullo was selected for the Engineering Hall of Fame at The George Washington University in 2007, was nominated to the US Patent Office Hall of Fame in 2010 and has received the Bronze Medal for Outstanding Service from the US Department of Energy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains documents, records, photographs, slides, negatives, transparencies, newspaper clippings, journals, publications, reports, correspondence, memos, personal files and receipts from Mario Cardullo. The material dates from 1955 to 2013.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into 3 series: Education; Professional; and Personal and Office Records. The Professional series is divided into 12 sub-series, with each series representing a company Cardullo worked for, as well as patents, publications and miscellaneous files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material in this series includes documents, records, correspondence, publications, and copies of degrees. They range in date from 1953-2013, with the bulk of the records from 1953-1959 and 2012-2013. The files represent Mario Cardullo's undergraduate and graduate education at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn (now known as the Tandon School of Engineering at New York University), and his PhD work at George Mason University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents, reports, publications, drawings, memos, correspondence, receipts, photos, negatives, transparencies, slides, and newspaper clippings that relate to Mario Cardullos professional life. The material ranges from 1957 - 2002.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is divided into 12 sub-series. Series 1-10 arranged in chronological order, Series 11 and 12 arranged in order received by doner. Each sub-series relates to a company that Cardullo worked at, as well as patents, publications and other micellnous files relating to Cardullo's professional career. Within each sub-series, folders are arranged chronologically. Folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Seires 2, Subseries 10 contains confidential corespondence regarding patent information. Special Collections will review materials in this subseries before researchers can access this subseries. Please contact Special Collections for more information.

did.unittitle: Liquid Rocket Propulsion Laboratory, Picatinny Arsenal, Dover, New Jersey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, records, correspondence, reports, publications, notes, and photographs. The material ranges from 1957-1961. It relates to Mario Cardullo's work as a project engineer at the Liquid Rocket Propulsion Laboratory, Picatinny Arsenal in Dover, New Jersey. Cardullo worked here from October 1957 until November 1961. He designed rocket engines, conducted tests and formulated requirements for Navy and Army programs and managed research and development.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders

Record of Invention, Recirculation Injector Venturi, Jet Pump Type
Record of Invention , Under Water Ramjet Propulsion System

Journal of the Aero Space Sciences
Effects of Simulation and Scale-up on Performance of Rocket Nozzle Materials
First U.S. Manned Suborbital Space Flight
Notes on Liquid Metal Heat Transfer

Study of Evaporation Rates and Temperature Variations in Water, Diesel, Oil and High Test Gasoline

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, records, correspondence, reports, publications, and notes. The material ranges from 1961-1963. This sub-series relates to Mario Cardullo's work as a senior development engineer at Honeywell Aeronautical Division in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Cardullo worked here from November 1961-March 1963. He was responsible for the design, development, and served as a market liaison for reaction control propulsion systems.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, reports, and publications. The material ranges from 1962-1965. It relates to Mario Cardullo's work as a member of the technical staff at Belcomm, Inc. in Washington, D.C. Cardullo worked here from March 1963 until November 1965. He was assigned to the Apollo program, performed various system planning studies and reviewed top-level NASA programs, schedules, and costs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders

did.unittitle: Closed Loop Heat Transfer Test Apparatus
Employment Letter and Personnel Security Questionnaire
Crushable Nozzle for LEM Descent Engine
Game Theory applied to Flight Readiness Tests

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, reports, publications, memos, and correspondence. The material ranges from 1961-1973. It relates to Mario Cardullo's work as a planning officer and member of the technical staff at Communications Satellite Corporation in Washington, D.C. Cardullo worked here from November 1965-January 1970. He prepared and evaluated corporate goals, plans, and alternatives. He also developed system plans for utilization of satellites for domestica nad other applications, and coordinated these activities with the company, governmental and international agencies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains reports, publications, correspondence, drawings, transparencies, and slides. The material ranges from 1976-1986. This sub-series relates to Mario Cardullo's work at the Federal Energy Administration in Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains reports, publications, correspondence, office records, and receipts. The material ranges from 1990-2005. This sub-series relates to Mario Cardullo's work at the International Trade Administration of the US Department of Commerce in Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, reports, publications, memos, correspondence, newspaper clippings, transparencies, and slides. The material ranges from 1968 - 1970. This sub-series relates to Mario Cardullo's work at Communications Services Corporation and Telsev, Inc. in Rockville, Maryland Cardullo worked here from January 1970- August 1971. Here, Cardullo was the president and founder of these companies and established an integrated system for the acquisition and processing of medical data from remote locations as a service industry.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series relates to Mario Cardullo's work at Yankee Noodle Dandy. It contains documents, reports, publications, correspondence, photographs, and negatives. The material ranges from 1983-1988. Cardullo founded this pasta restaurant.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.

did.unittitle: Private Placement Memo Yankee Noodle Dandy

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders in this sub-series are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, reports, publications, memos, correspondence, schematics and presentation materials. The materilas range from 1994-1995. This subseries relates to Cardullo's employment at the Belfeild Group Inc. in Alexandria, Virginia, where he served as Managing Director.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders in this subseries are arranged in order recieved by the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, patent records, reserach notes, and correspondence. The material ranges from 2007-2013. Folders in this subseries relate to patents held by Cardullo, both in the United States and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, reports and publications. The materials range from 1963-2001, but are primarily undated. The folders in this subseries relates to publications written or co-written by Mario Cardullo, including publications on the Catholic Church and Electric Vechicles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains documents, patent records, buisness plans, reserach notes, presentation materials, reports, and correspondence. The materials range from 1983-2012, but are primarily undated. Records in this subseries relate to Mario Cardullo's buisness and scientific career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders in this subseries are arranged in order recieved by the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents, publications, notes, memos, correspondence, record books, photos, negatives, and slides that relate to Mario Cardullos personal life and personal office records. The material ranges from 1956-2005.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically and folders that are undated are arranged alphabetically, and placed after the chronologically ordered folders.
